Tripiá¹­aka Master from South India during the Tang Dynasty

Thus have I heard.
At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in the palace of the noble AvalokitÃªÅ›vara on Mount Potalaka.
The ground was adorned with innumerable precious sÄl trees, tamÄla trees,
caá¹ƒpaka trees, aÅ›oka trees,
and various precious trees such as atimÅ«ktaka.
It was surrounded by adornments.
He was together with a great assembly of eight thousand bhiká¹£us,
ninety-nine koá¹­Ä«s of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas,
and innumerable hundreds of thousands of ÅšuddhÄvÄsa devas.
The lord of devas, the great lord of devas,
the deva of great purity, and others were at the head.
And the other innumerable hundreds of thousands of devas and humans.
Surrounded in front and back, the Buddha was expounding the Dharma for them.
At that time, the noble AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva.
Rose from his seat and bared his right shoulder.
Touching his right knee to the ground, he bowed to the Buddha with palms joined.
With a smiling face, he addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One, I have a divine mantra called the Unfailing Lasso.
In the past, during the ninety-first eon,
there was a world called Supreme Contemplation.
The Buddha was called the Tathagata King of Worldly Rulers.
I received this mantra from that Buddha.
World-Honored One, because I upheld this divine mantra,
I taught and transformed countless hundreds of thousands of pure abode celestial sons,
the celestial son of freedom, and the great celestial son of freedom,
causing them to head towards supreme, perfect enlightenment.
By the power of this merit, I attained ten koá¹­is of samÄdhis,
with the unsurpassed wondrous wisdom of emptiness as the foremost.
World-Honored One, wherever this mantra is,
that place will be protected by twelve koá¹­is of gods such as MaheÅ›vara.
It will be like a Buddha's stÅ«pa.
World-Honored One, this divine mantra
Wherever this mantra is recited,
one should know that the beings there have already planted good roots with immeasurable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of Buddhas.
World-Honored One, if there are people who hear this mantra,
even if they have previously committed evil karma and engaged in non-dharma,
slandered the virtuous, and defamed the true Dharma,
as well as slandered all Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Sravakas, and Pratyekabuddhas,
they will definitely fall into the Avici Great Hell.
World-Honored One, if those people hear this divine mantra and feel remorse,
if they observe the precepts for one day and night and recite this divine mantra,
they will be able to eliminate all their evil karma.
Or it will cause all their evil karma to be experienced lightly in this life.
If they contract a fever,
for one day, two days, up to seven days,
or if they have pain in the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, lips, teeth, gums, palate, heart, abdomen, navel, sides, hands, feet, limbs, joints, and so on,
If one obtains hemorrhoids, diarrhea, constipation, white leprosy, or large leprosy,
If one has scabies, psoriasis, black sores, red sores, oozing sores, or blisters,
Or if one has diseases such as epilepsy or is bewitched by spells and poisons,
Bound, beaten, slandered, or reviled,
And other evils that afflict the body and mind, as well as strange dreams,
I will now explain that by experiencing them,
The uninterrupted evil karma will be immediately eliminated.
How much more so for sentient beings with pure faith who uphold this mantra?
How could all their evil karma not be eliminated?
World-Honored One, if there are sentient beings,
With their deceitful and deceptive minds,
Hearing what I say about the mantra heart of the Unfailing Noose,
Pretending to uphold it,
Either writing it themselves or having others write it,
Explaining it to others and having them listen and uphold it,
Even reciting this mantra heart in the ears of animals beside them,
And contemplating the mantra phrases,
Because of not slandering it and because of its signlessness,
Because of non-arising and non-discrimination.
Because of slow arrival and non-action.
Because of detachment, equality, non-abandonment, and separation from the aggregates.
In this way, one cultivates the corresponding skillful means.
By the power of recollecting the Buddha's merits,
in each of the ten directions, there appear a thousand Buddhas before him.
Having seen this, all his offenses and misdeeds are completely extinguished.
World-Honored One, I now speak in brief.
Even if someone copies this sutra
and places it in their home to make offerings and pay homage,
they will also attain immeasurable and boundless blessings and virtues.
How much more so for those who uphold, recite, and chant it!
World-Honored One, if there are sentient beings
who each do so in order to surpass others,
or out of fear of their superiors, fear of enemies,
fear of ferocious beasts, fear of danger and difficulty,
or out of following others, seeking nobility, seeking wealth and treasures,
and listen to this mind-dharani sutra,
even though they listen, they do not give rise to respect,
Or they may slander, despise, or disparage it.
By the majestic spiritual power of AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva,
Even those people will also give rise to supreme blessings.
It is like a person
Who takes sandalwood or musk,
Slanders and disparages it, grinds it into powder, and uses it to anoint their body.
But those fragrances will never think,
Because this person slanders me,
They are stingy with their fragrance and do not give it to them. The inherent fragrance of sandalwood and so forth makes its fragrant function.
World-Honored One, this spiritual mantra heart is also like this.
Even if there is slander and disparagement,
Or if it is written or upheld with flattery and deceit,
It will still create the causes and conditions for wholesome roots.
In every lifetime,
One will always not be apart from the provisions of morality, concentration, wisdom, and blessings and virtues.
In the future, one will be replete with the fragrance of morality.
World-Honored One, if there are good men, good women,
Bhiká¹£us, bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä«s,
UpÄsakas and upÄsikÄs.
On the eighth day of the month, they should single-mindedly observe the precepts of fasting and not mix in other words.
Recite this mantra of the Unfailing Lasso seven times.
That person will attain twenty kinds of supreme benefits in their present body.
What are the twenty?
First, the body will be free from other illnesses.
Second, due to previous karmic actions, if there are various illnesses, they will quickly be eliminated.
Third, the body will have a lustrous complexion, fine and soft skin, and those who see it will rejoice.
Fourth, many people will love and respect them, and they will closely guard their faculties.
Fifth, they will obtain wealth and treasures.
Sixth, having obtained wealth and treasures, they will not be robbed by thieves.
Seventh, they will not be carried away by floods or burned by fires.
Eighth, they will not be invaded by the power of kings.
Ninth, all their undertakings will be accomplished well.
Tenth, the seedlings they plant
will not be harmed by evil winds, heavy rains, frost, hail, or locusts.
Eleventh, if one recites this mantra seven times,
sprinkle the ashes and water in the eight directions and above and below to form a boundary.
All calamities will be eliminated.
Twelfth, one will not be robbed of one's vital energy by evil ghosts and others.
Thirteenth, all sentient beings will love and enjoy seeing one.
Fourteenth, one will not fear enemies.
Fifteenth, if there are enemies, they will quickly reconcile.
Sixteenth, one will not fear harm from humans and non-humans.
Evil spells and sorcery will not be able to harm one.
Seventeenth, one will not have intense afflictions and secondary afflictions.
Eighteenth, one will not die from fire, weapons, poison, or medicine.
Nineteenth, one will always be protected by the celestial good spirits.
Twentieth, wherever one is born, one will not be separated from loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.
These twenty kinds of excellent benefits
should be earnestly sought.
There are also eight dharmas. What are the eight?
First, when one is about to die,
the holy AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva will appear in the form of a bhiká¹£u before that person.
Second, when one is about to die,
one will peacefully give up one's life without any pain or suffering.

Third, when one is about to die, one will be mindful and present, with an unconfused mind.ğŸ”½Fourth, when one is about to die, one's hands will not be in disarray and one's feet will not stretch out and retract.
Fifth, when one is about to die, one will not leak urine or feces.
Sixth, even if one is sick, one will not be bedridden.
Seventh, when one is about to die, one will not die face down.
Eighth, when one is about to die, one will attain inexhaustible eloquence.
After one's life ends, one will be reborn in the pure lands of the buddhas according to one's wishes.
And one will not part from the good and virtuous friends.
World-Honored One, if good men and good women
do not eat alcohol, meat, pungent and spicy things, and defiled leftovers,ğŸ”½and recite this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« and mind-oriented teaching three times a day, each time three recitations,
then
The superior merits will increase day and night.
Understand the abilities and limitations of all beings according to their level of understanding.
Bodhisattvas should not be stingy with their minds.
Forever free from all evil, stinginess, and jealousy.
Always for the sake of benefiting all beings.
Swiftly proceed to enlightenment and enter the stage of a bodhisattva.
What is called enlightenment is called prajÃ±Ä.
What is called sattva is skillful means.
These two kinds of dharmas.
For all beings, one will attain all benefits and happiness.
World-Honored One, I now wish to benefit and bring happiness to the fourfold assembly of disciples.
And other beings who have committed offenses.
I only pray that the World-Honored One will take pity and grant permission.
In the presence of the TathÄgata, I will speak this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« heart.
At that time, the World-Honored One.

I also rejoice in this divine dhÄraá¹‡Ä« heart.
In the future, they will become parents for those practicing the bodhisattva vehicle.
They will enable bodhisattvas to quickly accomplish their tasks.
At that time, the holy AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva MahÄsattva
Gazed at the World-Honored One's face without blinking for a moment.
And said to the Buddha,
World-Honored One, I only pray that the TathÄgata will listen to me speaking this divine mantra.
It should be respectfully bowed to by all bodhisattvas.
This liberation Dharma door compassionately benefits the world,
Benefiting and bringing peace to innumerable sentient beings.
Those who wish to uphold it should first respectfully bow to the buddhas of the three times,
And to the bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and Å›rÄvakas.

May the activities I undertake be quickly accomplished.
May all my fears be removed.

The sound of ba sha one hundred and seventy-seven bhana la ti hu one hundred and seventy-eightğŸ”½Ha ha one hundred and seventy-nine hu one hundred and eighty hi one hundred and eighty-one
Pu ni pu ni one hundred and eighty-two sa va hu one hundred and eighty
This is the heart of the divine mantra.
Whatever is recited will have efficacy and whatever is done will be accomplished.
Recite three times in each of the three periods of the day.
The five heinous crimes will all be eradicated.
All karmic hindrances will be purified.
Burn agarwood incense or scatter ashes and water.
Or use white mustard seeds to form a boundary.
Or take khadira wood as stakes.
Enchant them twenty-one times and drive them into the four directions.
If suffering from any cold or hot fever,
Enchant a string to form a cord and wear it.
The illness will be cured.
For all who are sick,
Enchant ghee, oil, or water.
If the sick person takes it or applies it,
they will immediately be cured.
If they are bewitched,
they should make a human-shaped image out of flour paste or wax,
and cut it with a knife.
They should also have the bewitched person always wear a spell rope.
If they suffer from stomach pain,
they should recite the spell over salt water and have them drink it.
If they encounter various poisons,
recite the spell over soil or water.
If they apply it or drink it, it will be eliminated.
If they suffer from eye pain,
recite the spell over a white thread to make a rope and tie it to their ear.
If they suffer from toothache,
recite the spell over karavÄ«ra wood and use it to brush and chew.
If you wish to establish a boundary,
use khadira wood to make stakes and drive them into the four corners.
Recite the spell twenty-one times over a five-colored thread and wrap it around the stakes.
If you wish to protect yourself and others,
you should recite the spell over a rope to wear or recite the spell over water and ash and sprinkle them on their body.
If they suffer from any ghost illness,
Enchant a five-colored string to make a cord and wear it.
If suffering from any hot disease,
Enchant a white string to make a cord and wear it.
If suffering from any evil sores or swellings, or if the throat is blocked,
Mix honey with chebulic myrobalan and chant while taking it.
If suffering from eye disease,ğŸ”½Enchant perfumed water or water from the bodhi tree,
Or water from the licorice plant and use it to wash.
If suffering from earache,
Enchant sesame oil and drip it into the ear.
If in any disputes or slander,
Take enchanted water and wash the face with it.
If wishing to protect a capital city or village,
Take four vases filled to the brim with water,
And make great offerings of food and drink.
The one chanting the mantra should wear new clean clothes.
By reading and chanting this mantra, one will attain auspiciousness.
Furthermore, sprinkle that water in all directions.
Protecting all sentient beings,
All calamities and misfortunes will be eliminated.
If suffering from evil illness, grind sandalwood with water.
Recite the mantra twenty-one times and apply it to the heart.
If one has committed the four grave offenses, the five heinous crimes, or any of the uninterrupted offenses,
One should always recite this mantra and their sins will be eradicated.
If one wishes to protect a house,
One should take one hundred and eight lotus flowers.
Recite the mantra once for each flower and burn them in the fire.
If one wishes to make all sentient beings comply with oneself,
One should take one hundred and eight pieces of sandalwood, two inches long.
Recite the mantra once for each piece and burn them in the fire.
If one is possessed by ghosts or has fear,
One should take shaya medicine, fÃ©sha medicine,
nakuli medicine, gandhanakuli medicine,
vasti medicine, abhayavÄhinÄ« medicine,ğŸ”½indravÄhinÄ« medicine, gandhapaá¹­alÄgu medicine,
tagara medicine, Å›aktu medicine,
mahÄÅ›aktu medicine, viá¹£á¹‡uká¹›ntamÄá¹‡a medicine,
Sumanas, timely medicine, SÅ«nananda, and so on.
Grind these medicines into powder, mix with water to make pills.
Recite the mantra 108 times.
Place on the head, tie around the arms, or around the neck of a child.
Evil spirits and frightening things will all naturally disappear.
If there is a woman.
Due to little blessings, she is despised by others.
And those seeking a son.
Wear new clean clothes and recite the mantra over the medicine water.
For 21 times, bathe the body.
One will attain supreme blessings and evil signs will disappear.
Those seeking a son will get a son, and all will benefit.
Poison and fire will not invade, and calamities will not befall.
If one encounters violent winds, heavy rain, or hail.
Recite the mantra over water 21 times and sprinkle in the four directions.
If one recites the mantra over a stick of karavÄ«ra wood 21 times.
Point it at the sky and the winds and so forth will cease.
The great divine mantra of the holy AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva.
Accomplishes these most excellent deeds.
Those who have not yet accomplished [the practice] should paint a Buddha image on a plain cloth.
The colors used should be mixed with fragrant glue, not other glues.
Beside the Buddha image, paint an image of AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva.
His body is yellowish-white with dark hair hanging down, wearing a flower crown on his head.
He wears a tiger skin like MaheÅ›vara.
The bracelets and anklets are all adorned with precious jewels.
When the painter is about to paint,
he should first accept the eight precepts and observe the precepts.
After the image is completed,
in front of that image, use cow bezoar to make a maá¹‡á¸ala.
One zhang and six chi in length and width, scatter white flowers.
In the eight directions of the altar, place eight bottles of fragrant water.
Place eight portions of food or sixty-four portions.
Make offerings like this, excluding pungent and spicy foods.
Burn agarwood incense for three days and three nights without eating.
Or fast for one day and one night.
When eating, only eat the three kinds of daily food.
Every day, bathe three times, put on new clean clothes,
recite the mantra one thousand and eight times.
When the recitation is complete,
the practitioner will see their own body in front of the image,
with blazing light like a raging flame.
Having seen this, joy will arise in the mind.
The holy AvalokiteÅ›vara Bodhisattva will then appear before them,
fulfilling all their wishes and requests.
If one wishes to become invisible,
one should take realgar or asafetida, recite the mantra one thousand and eight times,
and one will then be able to become invisible and travel through the air.
One will attain the supreme samÄdhi of the foremost adornment of the unobstructed wisdom,
and all their wishes and desires will be fulfilled.
Having spoken thus,
the Blessed One joyfully praised this.
At that time, the holy AvalokiteÅ›vara Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva,
and the celestial son of the Pure Abode, the lord of the SahÄ world,
the great sovereign king of the MahÃªÅ›vara Heaven,
and the bodhisattvas, great Å›rÄvakas, and others,
Having received the Buddha's teachings, they joyfully accepted and practiced them.
